name: Titanium.Contacts
summary: The top-level Contacts module, used for accessing and modifying the system contacts address book.

events.name: reload
events.summary: Fired when the database backing the contacts module is modified externally.
events.description: If you have an existing reference to a Person or Group object, you should obtain a new reference from the Contacts module. Using the existing object may result in unpredictable behavior, such as updating the wrong contact.

methods.name: createGroup
methods.description: This method must be followed by save to commit its changes.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any in Titanium.Contacts.Group except those marked as non-creation or read-only.

methods.name: createPerson
methods.summary: Creates and returns an instance of Titanium.Contacts.Person, and commits all pending changes to the underlying contacts database.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any in Titanium.Contacts.Person except those marked as non-creation or read-only.

methods.name: getAllPeople
methods.summary: Gets all people, unless a limit is specified.

methods.name: getGroupByID
methods.summary: Gets the group with the specified identifier.

methods.name: getGroupByIdentifier
methods.summary: Gets the group with the specified identifier.

methods.name: getPeopleWithName
methods.summary: Gets people with a firstName, middleName or lastName field, or a combination of these fields, that match the specified name.

methods.name: getPersonByID
methods.summary: Gets the person with the specified identifier.

methods.name: getPersonByIdentifier
methods.summary: Gets the person with the specified identifier.

methods.name: hasContactsPermissions
methods.summary: Returns true if the app has contacts access.

methods.name: removeGroup
methods.summary: Removes a group from the address book.
methods.description: This method must be followed by save to commit its changes.

methods.name: removePerson
methods.summary: Removes a contact from the address book.
methods.description:
On iOS:

This method must be followed by a save action to commit the data to the underlying database, which can be done explicitly using save or implicitly using createPerson. Although the Titanium.Contacts.Person object will still exist once committed, it will no longer be valid. Continuing to use it will result in unpredictable behavior, including crashes.

On Android:

This method will remove the person from the Contacts book automatically.

methods.name: requestAuthorization
methods.summary: If authorization is unknown, will bring up a dialog requesting permission.
methods.description: Note that the callback may be synchronous or asynchronous. That is, it may be called during requestAuthorization or much later. See the "Request access to the address book" example on how to best use this method.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Callback function to execute when when authorization is no longer unknown.

methods.name: requestContactsPermissions
methods.description:
On Android, the request view will show if the permission is not accepted by the user, and the user did not check the box "Never ask again" when denying the request. If the user checks the box "Never ask again," the user has to manually enable the permission in device settings.

This method requests Manifest.permission.READ_CONTACTS and Manifest.permission.WRITE_CONTACTS on Android. If you require other permissions, you can also use requestPermissions.

In iOS 6, Apple introduced the Info.plist key NSContactsUsageDescription that is used to display an own description while authorizing contacts permissions. In iOS 10, this key is mandatory and the application will crash if your app does not include the key. Check the Apple docs for more information.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Function to call upon user decision to grant contacts access. Optional on SDK 10, as this method will return a Promise, which may be used to handle the result.

returns.summary: On SDK 10+, this method will return a Promise whose resolved value is equivalent to that passed to the optional callback argument.

methods.name: revert
methods.summary: Reverts all changes made by the previous save to the address book. Deprecated for >= iOS9.

methods.name: save
methods.summary: Commits all pending changes to the underlying contacts database.
methods.description:
On Android:

Takes an array of Titanium.Contacts.Person objects and saves changes for the specified contacts only.

parameters.name: contacts
parameters.summary: List of contacts to save. Used on Android only.

methods.name: showContacts
methods.summary: Displays a picker that allows a person to be selected.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: Argument containing parameters for this method. Optional on Android.

properties.name: contactsAuthorization
properties.summary: Returns an authorization constant indicating if the application has access to the address book.
properties.description:
Always returns AUTHORIZATION_AUTHORIZED on iOS pre-6.0 and Android devices.

If contactsAuthorization is AUTHORIZATION_RESTRICTED, you should not attempt to re-authorize: this will lead to issues.

properties.name: includeNote
properties.summary: A boolean value that indicates whether to fetch the notes stored in contacts or not.
properties.description:
This property need to be set before calling contacts APIs. From iOS 13 or later if your app fetch note field from contact, the app must have to set key 'com.apple.developer.contacts.notes' to 'true' in entitelements section of tiapp.xml.

<key>com.apple.developer.contacts.notes</key>
<true/>

See more details at https://developer.apple.com/documentation/bundleresources/entitlements/com_apple_developer_contacts_notes and https://developer.apple.com/contact/request/contact-note-field.

constants.name: AUTHORIZATION_AUTHORIZED
constants.summary: A contactsAuthorization value indicating that the application is authorized to use the address book.
constants.description: This value is always returned on Android devices, as well as on iOS versions earlier than 6.0.

constants.name: AUTHORIZATION_DENIED
constants.summary: A contactsAuthorization value indicating that the application is not authorized to use the address book.

constants.name: AUTHORIZATION_RESTRICTED

deprecated.notes: iOS 9 and later does not use this constant anymore. Use the other available AUTHORIZATION_* constants instead.

constants.summary: A contactsAuthorization value indicating that the application is not authorized to use the address book and the user cannot change this application's status.

constants.name: AUTHORIZATION_UNKNOWN
constants.summary: A contactsAuthorization value indicating that the authorization state is unknown.

constants.name: CONTACTS_KIND_ORGANIZATION
constants.summary: Specifies that a contact is an organization.
constants.description:
Used with the kind property.

One of the group of contact "kind" constants CONTACTS_KIND_ORGANIZATION, and CONTACTS_KIND_PERSON.

constants.name: CONTACTS_KIND_PERSON
constants.summary: Specifies that a contact is a person.
constants.description: Used with the kind property. One of the group of contact "kind" constants CONTACTS_KIND_ORGANIZATION, and CONTACTS_KIND_PERSON.

constants.name: CONTACTS_SORT_FIRST_NAME
constants.summary: Specifies that group members will be sorted by first name.
constants.description: Used with the sortedMembers method. One of the group of contact group "sort" constants CONTACTS_SORT_FIRST_NAME, and CONTACTS_SORT_LAST_NAME.

constants.name: CONTACTS_SORT_LAST_NAME
constants.summary: Specifies that group members will be sorted by last name.
constants.description: Used with the sortedMembers method. One of the group of contact group "sort" constants CONTACTS_SORT_FIRST_NAME, and CONTACTS_SORT_LAST_NAME.
